title: Basic Intros: 'I am O Justin'
reading_greek:
INTRODUCING SELF:
Είμαι ο Τζάστιν. (I am Justin.)
Είμαι η Μαρία. (I am Maria.)

INTRODUCING OTHERS:
Αυτός είναι ο Πέτρος. (This is Petros.)
Αυτή είναι η Κατερίνα. (This is Katerina.)

INTRODUCING OBJECTS:
Είναι το βιβλίο. (It is the book.)
Είναι ο δρόμος. (It is the road.)
Είναι η ώρα. (It is the time.)
Είναι το νερό. (It is the water.)
reading_english:
GRAMMAR: PROPER NOUNS [(See Page 15)](/assets/grammar.pdf#page=15)

In Greek, names take articles!
- You don't say 'I am Justin'.
- You say 'I am THE Justin' (Eimai O Justin).
- 'I am THE Maria' (Eimai H Maria).

GRAMMAR: 'THIS IS'
- Greek doesn't strictly separate 'It is' vs 'This is' yet.
- 'Einai to vivlio' = It is the book / This is the book.
- Use the gender of the object (O, H, To).
audio_script:
Introductions! The biggest surprise for English speakers is the Article on Names. 

If your name is Peter, you are 'O Petros'. 
If your name is Maria, you are 'H Maria'. 

So when you introduce yourself, say 'Eimai O [Name]'. 

Also, to point at things, we used the verb 'Einai' (It is). 
'Einai to nero' (It is the water / This is the water). 
Remember to match the article: O dromos, H ora, To vivlio.
